cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north overnight, then north-northeast on Friday, moving toward the southwest-central Louisiana coast while skirting the Upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, Louisiana (within the High Island TX – Morgan City LA hurricane warning area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch east of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA; Tropical Storm Warning west of High Island to Sargent, TX and east of Morgan City to the mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast and south-central Louisiana coast, especially Sabine Pass to Morgan City
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely by early Friday with a 46 % chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds and a 16 % chance of hurricane-force gusts at Port Arthur/Beaumont.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast surge 4–7 ft at Sabine Pass to Holly Beach and 2–4 ft from High Island to Sabine Pass; Sabine Lake could reach 1–3 ft above ground.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding in the Beaumont area Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday, very rough surf and dangerous rip currents, navigational restrictions likely on the Sabine-Neches Waterway.
